modules.description: Handles reading from and writing to TPTP-formatted files, supporting FOF and CNF formulas. Processes include resolving includes, iterating over parsed inputs, and formatting output with configurable line width and rational number representation. Useful for working with automated theorem proving problems stored in TPTP files, such as parsing benchmarks or generating formula files.

This module provides parsing and printing functionality for FOF and CNF formulas in TPTP format, handling lex buffers and abstract syntax trees to read, skip comments, and format output with configurable line wrapping. It supports reading from and writing to TPTP files, including resolving includes and iterating over parsed inputs, with control over number representation and line width. Key data types include formula representations and lex buffers, enabling operations like parsing benchmarks, processing theorem proving problems, and generating readable formula files. Specific use cases involve converting internal formula representations into TPTP output and preparing input files for automated theorem provers.

This module defines the abstract syntax tree for TPTP FOF and CNF formulas, including support for annotated formulas, include directives, and comments. It provides functions to construct and compare AST elements such as variables, words, strings, and input statements. Use cases include parsing and manipulating TPTP logic files, validating formula syntax, and processing include directives with optional formula selections.

This module defines a set of token types representing logical symbols, keywords, and literals used in TPTP input formats, such as CNF, FOF, and FOT. It includes a parsing function that processes lexed input into a structured TPTP abstract syntax tree. Concrete use cases include parsing TPTP problem files and processing logical expressions in automated theorem proving workflows.

This module provides a lexer function `token` that reads and returns the next token from a `Lexing.lexbuf` input buffer, using a boolean reference to track whether parsing is inside a formula. It processes TPTP (Thousands of Problems for Theorem Provers) syntax, handling tokenization of logical expressions and directives. Concrete use cases include parsing TPTP problem files and interactive theorem proving input streams.

This module provides functions to convert TPTP abstract syntax tree (AST) elements—such as formulas, terms, atoms, and literals—into formatted strings or documents using a pretty-printing library. It handles AST nodes representing logical constructs (CNF, FOF, etc.) and file names, enabling use cases like generating human-readable output, debugging AST structures, or serializing TPTP files for storage or exchange.
